avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs have widely formed after continous SW and N winds, especially in gullies. Older snow is considered stable. Beware of terrain traps.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Continous SW winds and snowshowers dominated last weeks. Last days have been dominated by northerly winds and snow has drifted a little bit around mountain tops. A snowprofile was taken in Bláfjöll the 5th of Feb. in a NW facing aspect, revealing cold wind broken snow on top of hard packed isothermal snow. An ice layer seperated the isothermal snow and the cold windbroken snow. A rather high temperature gradient was in the top layers. Stability test showed no response. Temperatures have risen over the weekend but still remain below freezing. This could have compromised stability in the snowpack but it gets colder again this week.

travelAdvisory.comment: It has snowed in NE winds with most intensity in the Eastfjords. Wind slabs have formed widely after ongoing SW snowfall last week followed by N winds. These wind slabs could be unstable in various facies but especially in gullies and depressions. Freezing temperatures dominated last week and weakness could have further developed in the snowpack as a consequence. It got slightly warmer throughout the weekend.
travelAdvisory.highlights: wind slabs could be unstable in various facies but especially in gullies and depressions.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hvessir með Sunnudeginum og snýr í NA átt með snjókomu til fjalla aðfaranótt mánudags. Snýr í N átt á þriðjudag en úrkomulaust. Lítilsháttar hlýindi eru væntanleg þar sem hiti gæti náð frostmarki til fjalla á mánudag. Kólnar aftur í vikunni.

avalancheActivity.comment: Small collapses have been seen in W-facing hills this weekend. Two avalanches released in Súðavíkurhlíð on Tuesday 6.2. in NW winds, one of them closed the road. Two avalanches fell on and right by the same road early on Saturday 3.2. after ongoing SW winds. Avalanches also fell in Súðavíkurhlíð on the evening of 30th of Jan and the night before 1st of Feb.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Layered wind slabs are in all aspects. Observations indicate multiple weak layers in the snowpack and increased likelihood of human triggered avalanches. Compressions tests in the area gave a sudden collapse with medium load. NE snowfall is expected for Monday and snow could drift considerably towards S facing hills.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow thawed up to 600m height last week. On top, new wind slabs have formed, first in SW winds and later in NW-NE winds. Layered wind slabs are in all aspects and weaknesses have been found between layers. Snow pits in the area from the 7th, 8th and later 10th of February confirm this and compression tests gave a sudden collapse at 10-40 cm depth. Even though there is still rather little snow in mountains for the season, people travelling in steep terrain are asked to be careful. There is an increased risk of human triggered avalanches that can be dangerous. In the cold weather this week, weak layers might have evolved even further due to a high temperature gradient in the snow and growth of facets.

travelAdvisory.comment: It has snowed in NE winds with most intensity in the Eastfjords. Wind slabs have formed widely after ongoing SW snowfall last week followed by N winds. These wind slabs could be unstable in various facies but especially in gullies and depressions. Freezing temperatures dominated last week and weakness could have further developed in the snowpack as a consequence. It got slightly warmer throughout the weekend.
travelAdvisory.highlights: wind slabs could be unstable in various facies but especially in gullies and depressions.

weatherForecast.highlights: Það hvessir í NA átt á mánudag með snjókomu og gæti vindur náð 20-30 m/sek til fjalla. Snjó mun líklega skafa í suðlægar hlíðar. Hlýnar með mánudegi en lægir og frystir aftur á þriðjudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: A 40 m wide and up to 1 m thick slab was triggered by a snowmobile in a steep S-facing hill 10.2. An avalanche was spottet in Auðnahyrna 8.2, probably from 7th of Feb. An avalanche was spotted in Skarðsdalsvik 7.2. on a west facing slope. A slab avalanche was spotted on Tuesday morning 7.2. in a south facing gully in Bakkadalur. A slab avalanche fell over the road Ólafsfjarðarvegur on Tuesday afternoon, 6.2, east facing. Earlier the same morning, an avalanche released in Ólafsfjarðarmúli, but it was smaller and stopped above the road. A few slab avalanches were recorded early last weekend in various aspects, above Ólafsfjarðarvegur, in Dýjadalur, Tungudalur and Burstabrekkudalur
avalancheActivity.highlights: About 40 m wide slab was triggered 10.2. in a steep S-facing hill in Upsadalur. Unstable windslabs should be expected after snowfall in NNW-NNE winds on Monday and Tuesday. New slabs expected in strong NE- and later NNW-winds with snowfall until Tuesday

snowpackStructure.highlights: On Monday and Tuesday, much snow was added and transported in NNW-NNE winds. Windslabs formed widely and are still unstable in steep slopes. In the storm, avalanches released in E, S and W aspects. Before, wind slabs were in various aspects after SW and variable winds. A snow pit in Skarðsdalur 7.2. showed a layered snowpack. CT gave a collapse in the new snow at medium load. Deep in the snowpack was a weak layer with facets from the new year. ECTP17 with planar fracture between a hard slab and the firn below in Vatnsendahnjúkur W-face in Héðinsfjörður 11.2 and some whumps noticed. Whumps also in Karlsárdalur and the sledge triggered slab in Upsadalur 10.2. show that persistant windslabs can be tricky

travelAdvisory.comment: It has snowed in NE winds with most intensity in the Eastfjords. Wind slabs have formed widely after ongoing SW snowfall last week followed by N winds. These wind slabs could be unstable in various facies but especially in gullies and depressions. Freezing temperatures dominated last week and weakness could have further developed in the snowpack as a consequence. It got slightly warmer throughout the weekend.
travelAdvisory.highlights: wind slabs could be unstable in various facies but especially in gullies and depressions.

weatherForecast.highlights: Gengur í stífa A-NA-átt með snjókomu á sunnudagskvöld, snýst í N- og NNV-átt á þriðjud. með minnkandi úrkomu

avalancheActivity.comment: Small avalanche in inner Bræðslugjá by Neskaupstaður from 7th or 8th of February.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Updated 12.2. at 9:45: Uncertainty phase due to avalanche danger is in effect in the Eastfjords. Much snow has been added since Sunday evening, especially around Seyðisfjörður, but less in other fjords. Windslabs in easterly and southerly aspects, especially in gullies and lows, after strong NW-N wind and snowshowers 5 days ago. New slabs expected in strong NE- and NNW-winds until Tuesday with heavy snowfall for a while

snowpackStructure.highlights: Much snow has been added since Sunday evening, especially around Seyðisfjörður, and drifted in NE-E winds. Before were new windslabs in easterly and southerly aspects, especially in gullies and lows, after strong NW-N wind and snowshowers. The windslanbs may be unstable. High in mountains there are older windslabs that may be porly bonded with harder older snow. In lower part of mountains older snow is considered stable.

travelAdvisory.comment: It has snowed in NE winds with most intensity in the Eastfjords. Wind slabs have formed widely after ongoing SW snowfall last week followed by N winds. These wind slabs could be unstable in various facies but especially in gullies and depressions. Freezing temperatures dominated last week and weakness could have further developed in the snowpack as a consequence. It got slightly warmer throughout the weekend.
travelAdvisory.highlights: wind slabs could be unstable in various facies but especially in gullies and depressions.

weatherForecast.highlights: Stíf NA- og síðar NNV-átt. Áköf úrkoma um tíma og bætir talsvert á snjó til fjalla fram á þriðjudag en líklega slydda eða rigning við sjávarmál
